Class LdvReadSetIndexTable

java.lang.Object
  forward.ForwardLogicalDataView
      forward.LdvReadSetIndexTable

public class LdvReadSetIndexTable
extends ForwardLogicalDataView

copyright (c) 2010-2012 e-Amrita - Giampietro Zedda Turin (ITALY)

LdvReadSetIndexTable

Gets all tables defined by the Forward generalized table system.
Only the language must be set externally, otherwise ENGLISH will be used.
It will be returned a set of rows with two sinificative columns: codeTable and descTable.
codeTable is a string with the table number and descTable the localized table description.

Since:
27/mar/2012
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Giampietro Zedda
See Also:
LdvReadItemRuleTable, LdvReadSetRuleTable

Method Detail

declare

public void declare()
Description copied from class: ForwardLogicalDataView

Declare logical data view specification


declare() contains calls declaring logical data view methods.

Applications function classes must extends ForwardLogicalDataView, an abstract class that define
just the abstract method declare().
Forward monitor calls declare() in the initialization process to build logical data view structures.

The declare() method must be filled by user with the only declaratives:
FOR_ANY(), FOR_EACH(), FOR_SQL(), INSERT(), UPDATE() and DELETE()

After the execution of the declare() method the logical data view is not still executable.
The validate() method mustr be called to make the logical data view executable.

Specified by:
declare in class ForwardLogicalDataView
